website_summaries.verdict: This model sacrifices just a little power to be extremely lightweight, and is a good option for people with small lawns who only need to manicure from time to time.
pros: Like other Black+Decker trimmer-edger combos, this unit boasts an automatic spool feed and 1-click conversion from trimmer to edger
However, what sets this model apart is the ability to maneuver its 4.5 pound weight, light enough for virtually anyone to use
The 1.5 amp-hour battery can last up to 45 minutes, and provides enough power to accomplish the routine edging and light trimming tasks demanded by the average lawn
cons: This unit is less powerful than some BLACK+DECKER models, and may not be a good option for large lawns or areas where growth is very thick

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this! Now this is not a high powered gas weed eater that can destroy small trees, but it does the job of trimming a lawn nicely. I've used it twice, the 1st time the grass was very wet and the battery lasted about 15 minutes, the second time the grass was dry and it ran 20 minutes. It is powerful enough to take down large weeds with a few passes and zips across the grass with no issues. It is easy to operate and very light weight. I would highly recommend this and if 20 minutes isn't long enough run time buy a second battery!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The thing I like about this is the auto-feed on the string. I know there are many out there that have wrestled with string feed, but this really has worked well for me. Have done my entire yard five times without issue, which is a miracle for me. Battery lasts very well, but make sure you get it on the charger after use. Heads and shoulders above a gas model.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Needs manual line feed
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tool but whenever someone decides to make something "automatic" it seldom is a good idea. Manual line feed for this device is mandatory. The line cutting length is short to begin with. With auto line feed, the line only feeds about 2 1/2 inches of line which is insufficient to cut almost anything of an consequence. Regret buying this item and would not buy again. Auto line feed is a poor design for this product and does not work most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Life is good in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than i thought!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is pretty powerful! I'm surprised since its battery powered I figured it wouldn't cut through much but it does! I've got some pretty nasty weeds around my fence and shed and it took them down no problem. I'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: R13

customer_reviews.title: WORST - TOOL - EVER
customer_reviews.text: Never had a rechargeable weedeater before. But then again, I also never had a weedeater that wouldn't eat weeds. Charge on the battery lasts about 15-20 minutes, which is just enough time for it to chew up about half of the weeds I expose it to and covering about half of my front yard (which is a very standard sized suburban yard). I have no idea why this thing won't eat weeds, but it really doesn't even begin to do the job. I've had good success with Black & Decker in the past, but not this time. PATHETIC!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight, small, quiet, don't have to deal with 2-cycle gas/oil mixture, head rotates for edge trimming, comes with two batteries. Cons: Underpowered, not good for anything but small, well-manicured lawns. If you have a large yard or need to trim anything but grass, this device is insufficient.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rice

customer_reviews.title: This was just crap
customer_reviews.text: The device not only didn't hold enough charge to trim my SMALL front and back yard, not even on two batteries. SADLY this isn't the worst part! Before I was able to finish the back yard, of which I trimmed first, the large guard broke off. Upon inspection it was a SINGLE SMALL screw holding the guard to the device. This was a true disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Z.Borders

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a couple months now and its just not great. I had an old weedeater from the same brand and it is miles ahead of this one. Only comes with 1 battery that only lasts 10-15 minutes tops and really only has power for the first minute or two. The string that comes with this is absolute trash. Every few minutes i have to stop and pull string out because its as strong as a wet noodle. The company obviously cut many corners when making this compared to older models, steer clear of this one. 3 stars because it runs
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Something odd with the packaging
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in what looked like the manufacturer's box but one end was strangely taped up like someone had already opened it. Also, the spool and the battery charger were completely loose in the box with no protective packaging, falling from one end to the other as the box was handled. Very odd. The line on the spool didn't feed correctly until my husband rewound it by hand (after a call to the factory and getting their advice). Despite all that, the trimmer and battery charger seem to be working ok. I'm an older woman and wanted a lightweight trimmer/edger to do detailing on our yard. This works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kathlyn

customer_reviews.title: good for light trimming
customer_reviews.text: This works great for regular trimming. It is super quiet and weighs almost nothing. The battery life is adequate for a smaller yard. We have a large property so I bought an extra battery. The string self feeds automatically which is very convenient. My only real complaint is that it can't handle really thick grass or thicker stalks. I think this has more to do with the thickness of the string than the power of the machine. It is great for regular trimming though.
customer_reviews.author: sw

customer_reviews.title: A fun, functional and very useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most wonderful tools I have ever bought. I am 82 years old and do much of my own yard work but need something that is light so that I can keep working with it and also effective. This tool is both and it is a joy to work with and I just look forward to working in the yard when I know I'm going to be working with my Black & Decker weed wacker. I had to look back on my purchases because this almost a year that I've had it and I still enjoy it and it works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and it's very convenient to own when you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and it's very convenient to own when you have all of Black and Decker's 20 Volt battery tools like the drill and the blower. Batteries interchangeable. I dont know how long the battery lasts, because I only use it for quick touch ups, but it should be long enough for small or medium jobs, and the batteries recharge fairly quickly. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and clean!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dedicated gas string trimmer, but I bought this one for the wife because she always wants to help with yardwork. I’ve been using it more than she has. As long as you understand an electric trimmer’s limitations, you’ll be happy with this item. For small yards, and light trimming around the house/fence posts/trees/etc., it’s perfect. Will it clear out a thicket or brush? No. But, it’s not made for that. It will run about 15 minutes NON STOP on a full charge. If you learn to let go of the trigger more often, you’ll get a little more time. It’s lightweight. It’s relatively quiet, and for most basic trimming, it will work great!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I have rarely if ever been driven into utter despair after using a product for the first 30 seconds like with this weedwacker. To say it struggles with basic trimming functionality is a gross understatement and as an edger it is completely useless. The motor on my sons $10 battery car toys is stronger than this. It was promptly returned. I wonder if a product manager should be sacked for thinking its worthwhile putting this tool on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Dom K.

customer_reviews.title: A winner.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small lawn/garden area with pesky weeds. We have some recalcitrant stuff that just won't go away after much digging etc. This lightweight trimmer is great. Didn't want to mess with long cords ($$ too) or gas stuff. I'm older and not as strong as I used to be and this is lightweight and suits my ability fine. On first use (after charging battery for a few hours) it had a tough 20 minute workout wacking some medium heavy stuff before it lost charge. So 5 stars. Def worth the price to avoid long extension cords...even or small property.
customer_reviews.author: Communication Services, University

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a commercial gas powered Toro that is too heavy, long, and bulky for my wife to use. She's short and skinny at age 62. BUT this weed trimmer is perfect for her and with 2 charged batteries she can more than handle the trimming around the house while I tackle the bigger weeds with my big Toro along culverts and 12 acres of fences. My wife loves this weed eater and it is light enough that she can handle an hour with it. 5 stars for her and the Black and Decker 20 volt battery weed trimmer!
customer_reviews.author: Ambergris

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a model older than this one that I love. My sister has difficulty with tools that are too heavy and she actually loved mine and found it easy to use. This is a newer model but was even lighter which she really appreciates. She enjoys it and I no longer have to go to her house to trim as she can handle it fine. Haven't used it enough to comment on the battery life but lithium batteries last longer than the old style. Being cordless makes it easy to trim the far edges of the property. The entire yard can be trimmed with one charged battery.
customer_reviews.author: debbie700

customer_reviews.title: Love this weed eater!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this first because of it being Black and Decker and second because of the weight. I'm a 70 year old female and have been wanting a weed eater that I could use but wouldn't leave me sore and exhausted. This one is so light weight I can really get a lot done and the battery charges quickly. Now if I can get my husband to leave it alone and use his own.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Auto line feed doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a B&D LTE525. The line feed function has quit working and I had to stop and advance it by removing the spool cap. Well, I used this one twice and I can't get it to advance the line either! So I spent $80 on something that doesn't work either. If it were more difficult to advance the line manually I would give it 1 star and classify it as a POS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Are you listening B&D!!!? Anyone else out there have similar experience?
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for Llamas
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as a gentle "motivator" for my pet llamas when they stubbornly resist me. It worked well at first, as their thick coats provide adequate, but not too adequate padding, but soon the llamas learned to recognize the "motivator" due to its bright orange color and began running away (Lamas are naturally good at seeing orange). If your planning on using this on llamas, or any type of domesticated Guanaco, I'd recommend the Ryobi model as llamas cannot see the color green.
customer_reviews.author: S. N.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expecting the battery life to be not great. So on any given day I wouldn't have to spend too much time actually working. Nope, shouldn't have counted on that. Today I kept going, trying to see if I could run it dead. I finished the house, garden, trees, still going strong so I cleaned out the ditches and edged next to the road. Still not dead. Was starting to slow a bit towards the end but I got way more than the expected 20min run time.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Good for light work
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this trimmer. It’s assembly was quite simple. The battery is easy to move from the charger to the trimmer. I have a small yard with limited trimming and this trimmer does very well. It is not extremely powerful so I question how it would work for heavy weeds or for an extended period of time. But for me it’s great. The head swivels so it can be used as a sidewalk trimmer. I have absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: L Boettcher

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this product once or twice. For the price it has everything you need to trim small areas. It is light and easy to use. The battery is so much better than a gas driven trimmer. I also can use this battery with my Black & Decker blower which is a great product. What I do with these products is buy several batteries so I always have a charged battery is the job is bigger than one battery will last. Black & Decker local facilities stand behind their product with replacements or parts.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: 1 year of light use and it's still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Bought this almost a year ago and I've loved it since day 1. So many advantages with this over the 3 gas powered weed trimmers i've gone through. Cheaper to run, easier to start/maintain, lighter in weight and a lot quieter. The battery could last a little longer, but for small lawns like mine I can trim around the house twice before needing to charge it again. I haven't had to replace the line or do any real maintenance in this first year of owning it, and it's running just as good as it did day 1. Would recommend to anyone with small lawns.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: NO BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: Upon reading about this 20Volt "KIT" string trimmer by Black and Decker......there is no "KIT" to it. You get NO BATTERY. The implications to me were you get a battery . So facts are....you get a string trimmer Without any battery!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery life and forever to charge
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this trimmer is that it has an run time of maybe 10 to 15min and is essentially an over-night charge time. People saying an hour running must be including walking around with it off, idk, but the actual time running was 15min at most with the 1.5AmpHr battery. Not nearly enough time to trim around my house (100ft) and do along the 150ft of street front. I thought I'd charge it and be back out in an hour or 2 to finish... Nope! It took over 6 hours to charge the 1.5AmpHr battery! So doing a 20min trim job becomes a 2 day chore.
customer_reviews.author: Zach n Liz

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something light weight and capable of cutting. This little string trimmer is just that. The battery will last about half an hour. It cuts through most weeds and grass. I wanted to see what this trimmer could do and tried cutting down some brush. It does okay with light brush but heavy brush, not so much. This is a great tool for trimming around the yard. It's not great for clearing out brush but no one would expect it to be. Out of the box, this trimmer is extremely easy to use. All I had to do was attach the guard and load the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Winker

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Does not feed the spool correctly, I have to constantly stop and pull the line through, I have purchased the black and decker 0.65 which is the correct line for this strimmer. It is extremely frustrating. I would stay clear of this one and get a better quality one. It is very cheaply made and flimsy also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I feel like the battery got stronger after the 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: Seriously impressive and stronger then I thought it would be. I feel like the battery got stronger after the 2nd use, as odd as that sounds. The 2nd time i used this thing it was shredding my yard, nearly as powerful as the gas one I had. This thing is awesome, forget mixing gas and oil anymore, push the button and go! Battery last about 45 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Quattro Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Such a cute little weed eater😍😍😍
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this weed eater for my dad's grave when I'm trimming grass around his Stone. I was using my 4 cycle weed eater but it was just too powerful for a little job like that. This Black & Decker is just perfect easy to assemble out the box plug the battery in and you're ready to rock and roll🎸!!!!! Now I have to order a blower to a go long with it👍💯
customer_reviews.author: MR RON

customer_reviews.title: Black & decker has done it again!
customer_reviews.text: Snagged one of these on sale with an off brand large battery ($27) and the battery will last doing my full front sides and back yard no problem. I took off the guard to add a little more cut length, still has good battery life. Impressed! Tested with stock battery, didn’t even finish the front lawn. Do yourself a favor and purchase a spare battery or two!
customer_reviews.author: Danman0614

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I had my previous black and decker 20v for almost 10 years. I replaced it this year and the new one seems just as good. Battery powered is so much better than having to deal with a gas line trimmer. I recharge my batteries after use and store inside. I think this has helped keep my batteries in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: MBomar

customer_reviews.title: It's light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's light and easy to use. I can trim 1/2 acre yard on 1 charge. Plus I have a drill that came with 2 batteries, so I have 3 batteries and 2 tools. It self feeds. I have not had to change spools yet, but it should be easy. I'm not too excited about the edging guide, so did not continue to use it. Easier without the guide. It's light enough for my wife to use, but she won't. She thinks she's to pretty to mow and edge. It's true though, she is.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight in both pounds & duty
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gone from a gas powered, to an electric, to this battery powered model. It is weak & seems like I can’t get it close enough to some areas along the fence line that the electric model pulverized. I will be lightly trimming tender weeds with this ones—the tough weeds will just laugh at being tickled by this weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Young

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy for me to carry around so now my husband doesn't have to drag the big gas one around. The battery holds more than enough charge for me to do our 3 yards. Around trees, clearing sprinklers, misc. lawn wild-hairs. I wish the string was a bit easier to lengthen but all in all, a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious reader

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool works great
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at other grass trimers including a Dewalt for much more money. Found to be terribly put together and very heavy. I couldn't believe how light this trimer is but so far does a great job. More plastic than more expensive trimers but since I just use it around home a perfect fit for my needs. ☺☺
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Legit tool for my yard maintenance
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Used it once on my yard after fully charging it and I was out about 20 minutes and had no issues. I will recharge for about 5 hours and then take off the power source, just to be safe. Lithium ion batteries are built to handle "over-charging" infinitely better than nickel cadmium batteries, but I still plan on charging it and then removing it. It's a little heavy but nothing crazy and it has enough power to do grass wacking along edging, minor weed control, etc. Go for something better if you have big jobs in store but, for someone just looking for basic use, this is perfect for your $.
customer_reviews.author: L Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Whack this
customer_reviews.text: This unit is everything it claims to be. Lightweight, works well and battery life is decent. Construction is a bit questionable. The safety button to engage the power trigger needs redesign. It's not properly placed and has a tendency to stick and I'm not certain it will hold up overtime.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: struggles to cut grass and wont cut weeds
customer_reviews.text: this unit is replacing a B&D eater that I used for about 8 years 'till the batteries died. overall it was o.k.. this one makes the old one look GREAT. LAST B&D I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: I did not think I could like this as much as a gas one but it ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not think I could like this as much as a gas one but it does the job and well. It is not for heavy duty use but it is great for most lawns. I use it on a 1/2 acre + lawn and it does it easily on the charge. The string comes out automatically, and it eats up weeds great. It is super lightweight which is nice and you have no cords or gas to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: GchanMako

customer_reviews.title: Smart little weed wacker.
customer_reviews.text: 100% what I was looking for. Worked great right out of the box. Just a warning to pick up a rapid charger, after my husband went out and played with it and killed it it took over 7 hours to recharge the battery. This is a 10 inch cut instead of a 12in cut but I wanted it for trimming around my flower beds so it's like I said exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy LVC

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and it works perfect. The battery lasted me about an hour and I was using it the whole time. I have other Black & Decker battery tools so I can interchange the batteries. I have 2 and they work very well so when 1 is charging you just switch to the other. I also have the large clippers and the reciprocating saw and all work great.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Onyx

customer_reviews.title: This one died quickly but generally B&D is a good brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this weed whacker in April 2020, used lightly, I'd say some 15 battery cycles, and in June 2020 it suddenly died emitting some white smoke in the process. I'm giving 2 stars and not 1 - because my previous Black and Decker weed whacker, very similar to this one in shape and color but slightly bigger (12 inch in diameter) did last for 3 years. I generally like Black and Decker tools, I own and had owned quite a few of them, and would recommend them most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Iv

customer_reviews.title: Zero power. Cuts nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely underpowered. I’m not sure what this was designed to cut but grass was not considered. Spend more and get a useful tool. This one will sit idle because it’s useless
customer_reviews.author: Svea Burska

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt have the power that the previous B & D product had and Im using same batteries. Its also shorter which I knew when I ordered it but thought it would at least have same power. If I had to do it again I would have spent another $20-30 to get the better product - my fault I guess.
customer_reviews.author: wlynns

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is too short. Even with extra batteries it kept dying. The battery would lose energy and then the motor would slow down, making it harder to weed wack because the motor doesn't keep a continuous speed. Had for only two moths before the motor died. Only have a one month window to return. I see why. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, did my whole back yard in one charge. I have a big backyard that had long grass up against the fence surrounding my yard. I will be buying an extra battery, but it trims grass and weeds really well and it's nice and quiet. Don't have to deal with any gas or oils. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RobinTheKiid

customer_reviews.title: I like the light weight of this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I like the light weight of this trimmer. It hesitates a bit cutting heavy weeds, but for most trimming it's great. I gave it 4 stars because it only runs about 45 minutes per battery charge. That's with the1.5 A battery that comes with it. I am going to order a 3A and see how that works. Will add another review once I've tried it with heavier battery.
customer_reviews.author: chevy77

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: After several years of good service from my battery powered hedge trimmers and string trimmer, was time to replace. Read the reviews and went with the Black & Decker 20v hedge trimmers and string trimmer. Very pleased with the construction of both units, lightweight but sturdy and not cheap feeling with good battery run time. A+
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Big help with weeds
customer_reviews.text: This has made it much easier for me to keep weeds under control, even though they insist on growing and growing. The string trimmer required some assembly, not much, on receipt. I found the battery difficult, at first, to latch onto the handle so you can use the tool. You really have to whack it down hard to get it to where it's supposed to be. Once you get the hang of it, it's much easier. On balance, I'm glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Stanger

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer Good For Light to Medium Duty
customer_reviews.text: I read some review that had concerns about battery life. I have not experienced it. I have a about 2/3 of an acre and plenty of trimming to do. It ran for 20-30 minutes with no problem. Very strong and light. I really like it. Now it is not heavy duty but that is not what I bought it for. I have had gas trimmers in the past, but they were a pain to start and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: David Frank

customer_reviews.title: I like to do my own yard work
customer_reviews.text: First off I am a senior woman. I like to do my own yard work , but my old weed wacker was getting too heavy for me and draging around that long cord was getting boring. This is very light and easy to change the cutting things. Just pop in a new spool. The battery is easy to remove and replace. I will keep this one.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie dean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Use for trimming weeds for gardening in the wild areas. Good for tight spots. Want to know how to store right, since the spinning head is not supposed to be on the ground according to the instruction manual. The line got stuck would not automatically come out only once. With the automatic feed line it is difficult to tell if it's getting over extended or not. It doesn't seem to use much extending, and the prewound spool lasts a long time. I can't find the manual line feed trimmers any more. This was a replacement to a corded Black and Decker trimmer which stopped working. This battery powered trimmer is much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This works GREAT! I had some doubt with the price point
customer_reviews.text: This works GREAT! I had some doubt with the price point, but I was pleasantly surprised. We have a huge yard, and I bought and extra battery, figuring I'd have to change them out, but the first battery lasted through the whole job....which was probably 1.5 hours of heavy trimming. This is SO much better than the expensive (HEAVY) one we bought a few years ago. If I could give it 10 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After hubby insisted on buying another brand's gas powered, heavy, awkward whacker, I tried to use it. There were so many steps to start the darn thing, my arms would ache before it ever started. So I bought myself this model. So lightweight. 1 button start. I've run it for an hour on 1 charge, + it's still charged + ready to go. Runs quiet, too!
customer_reviews.author: Vegan

customer_reviews.title: For lightweight use only
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new trimmer/edger and wanted something light enough for my wife to use regularly. We like the cordless feature (we've had corded ones before) and it is easy to use. However, this is made for light grass trimming and edging at best. Don't expect to be cutting tough weeds with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Conary

customer_reviews.title: It's fine for quick routine cutting and edging
customer_reviews.text: It charges rather slowly and that charge doesn't last all that long. It's fine for quick routine cutting and edging, but will run out of juice before you can tackle bigger projects. Still, for the price and not having to deal with the smell or noise of a gas trimmer and the cords of an electric, I would purchase again. Just know what you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Soares

customer_reviews.title: Did not have automatic string feeder
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the fact that it was sold as having this ability and it did not, tried going on their site to get more info, called company and was told to return, forget trouble shooting!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Clendinen

customer_reviews.title: Just fine except the charger
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is fine, really. It’s easy to use, reasonably maneuverable, and powerful enough for my purposes. I wish it cut 12” rather than 10”, but I wouldn’t have paid much more for that. My one issue is that the charger doesn’t work - and there doesn’t seem to be any way of dealing with that short of returning the entire trimmer, which seems silly. I do have a charger that works on this battery, but I’d like to have one with the trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Henri

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, but the line advancer cost it a star. There is no way to manually advance it and it sometimes doesn't come out enough.
customer_reviews.author: Nate in Herriman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight. Great that you can take the battery off to recharge just the battery without having to plug in the whole unit. Battery does not seem to last as long as my Toro that was about the same price, but I'm still trying out. Might get a second battery to have ready for back up. Love the auto dispense of string.
customer_reviews.author: Marki Chandler

customer_reviews.title: save your money and time
customer_reviews.text: junk... I bought this because of battery operated it's weak on cutting and battery might have lasted 20 min. you have to stop every cpl min to let more string out. I'm used to the electric b&d which I loved. just wanted to cut the cord but I'm sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Melisa

customer_reviews.title: Great weed eater
customer_reviews.text: We use this for light trimming. We don't use for severe over growth. Its so much lighter than our gas powered one. We purchased one for our house and like it so much we purchased as a house warming gift for our daughter and son in law.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little trimmer !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trimmer for a small area around my pond plants that my wheeled trimmer is too big for, it worked perfectly !!!! It got in some small hard to get areas and did a great job. It is very light and easy to use . I would recommend buying a second battery as I found the battery only lasted about 30 minutes, but that is all I needed to do the small area I had to do. It was more powerful than I expected for a small trimmer . The auto feed line is great , no bumping to get line out . I was quite surprised how well it worked .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this trimmer for about 5 months now. The battery is only good for about 15 minutes worth of trimming, and then it starts slowing down to the point where it's not really cutting anymore. So if you only have a small area to trim it would be fine, but for more than about 15 minutes worth of trimming you should probably look for a trimmer that has a longer lasting battery. The string breaks often, and so I find myself stopping every few minutes to spool out some more string as it doesn't have auto feed. On the plus side it's light weight and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Lavigne

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the pain
customer_reviews.text: Battery capacity is great and lasts more than 1 long session of trimming. However, the automatic feeding system is the worst I've ever encountered. After making several adjustments and having used 6 reels of Black and Decker replacement line and I cannot get more than 10 seconds of use before having to open the line case and pulling the string back through the output hole. I endured 2 summers of constantly having to manually feed the line through so my feedback is supported by a long period of use.
customer_reviews.author: ciddak

customer_reviews.title: The perfect tool for my small yard:
customer_reviews.text: I live on a one quarter acre lot in the city, and this trimmer is perfect for my home. I ordered the 4000 mAh battery to go with and I highly recommend you do the same. The battery that comes with the trimmer (2000 mAh) lasts about 10 minutes whereas the 4000 mAh battery lasts a little over 30 minutes. The trimmer arrived on time and was packaged very safely.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ryan.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for a cordless.
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the BEST battery powered trimmer. I almost was shacked by the edging ability (but uses much battery life, so I also ordered the Vanon 2-amp battery). With a second battery I trim my own yard, my next-door neighbor, and still do some edging!
customer_reviews.author: hiwatt

customer_reviews.title: Great weed whacker for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have 1/2 acre. I can do all around the house, lawn edges and general weed whacking. Got it all done one one charge. I used it again the next week after lawn mowing. I hadn't recharged, so I got about 3/4 done before battery ran low. This is a nice lightweight whacker. Glad I bought it. If you have a larger property, you may want to buy an additional battery, but I don't need one.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Duty Trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I wanted. Light duty, light weight, the battery lasts about as long as this old lady does, so it's perfect! I use for simple yard trimming and it works well. I like that the line advances on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Coddington

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs
customer_reviews.text: This weed whip is very light. The battery life is very good. It does the work I need it for. If you have large weeds It might not be what you want, but for light grass trimming it's fine. I'm glad I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Straight to the point review.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. Works excellent for light work. Not the best for medium to hard work like sidewalk edges. Battery life is not that impressive. Overall if you have a small yard to keep up with this is not a bad choice.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: For the price its been okay. I had a time with the self feeding of the line, but i think thats my fault... It isn't heavy duty, I mean we had some pretty thick grass growing over the sidewalk and it won't edge through that stuff, but light weed-eating its great. Along the fence it does a real good job and its nice and light. I like it fine. :)
customer_reviews.author: TexasVaughans

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for touch ups which is what I was looking for. The line feed is a bit odd, but it eventually feeds. I believe it might let the line get a bit too short before feeding more but it's a small issue. It's light and doesn't need a long cord - plus the battery interchanges with my blower
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: For very light cutting. Suggest buying the 12 inch which is a much better trimmer for practically the same money. I returned this item and purchased the 12 inch and very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: RAJ

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and with 2 batteries trims all day
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas powered weed eater but when I hurt my back I couldn’t use the pull start. This Ishtar weight trimmer was perfect for me and my wife while I was out of commission. Trims great with a single string and 10. Inch cutting diameter. The original string has lasted as long as we have used the trimmer. I bought an extra battery so one could be charging while the other is being used.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little electric edger!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Great for small yards and very powerful for a 20v. I have a gas one and this is great for subdivision homes. Haven’t done any edging as I use my gas for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Inferior Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to maneuver if you could get it to hold a charge. Both my son (who lives in KS) and I purchased this item and unbeknownst to the other at the time, we both returned this edger for the same reason; it would not hold a charge. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sara T. Colbert-Woodland

customer_reviews.title: it's a trimmer, people
customer_reviews.text: the device does what it claims to do, and pretty well. the battery charges quickly, and has plenty of life to deal with some trimming around the edges. i found it difficult to aim the trimmer at just the right piece of resistant grass: perhaps that will improve with practice. i can't say anything about long-term battery life, or details about the automatic line feed function: i just haven't had it long enough to know.
customer_reviews.author: David Rawson

customer_reviews.title: String dispenses itself....no tapping on the ground.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trimmer for older people. Very lightweight and easy to start! Works great around all my gardens and walks. Beats my big gas powered trimmer that's too heavy, too hard to start and too noisy!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Kerr

customer_reviews.title: I depend on Black and Decker
customer_reviews.text: I have other Black and Decker garden tools nd find them dependable I like the swivel head feature in that you do not have to hold the handle at an akward angle to trim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a bargin
customer_reviews.text: My old green battery string trimmer needed a new old style battery at $32...never had any power and only lasted under 10 minutes...this whole new B&D string trimmer cost only a few bucks more and has a much more powerful lithium battery....forget the old stuff...this is way better....Dave Murray
customer_reviews.author: David S Murray

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer for light use
customer_reviews.text: So I was looking for a trimmer to replace my gas trimmer for quick cleanups. I have two batteries (1.5AH) but still come up short. It needs a little more battery
customer_reviews.author: FJhobie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Battery when fully charged lasted only about 20 minutes. I expected much more as this is about the same as I got from and 18 v standard battery for the previous B &D battery/weed eater. Not any better than the old one except the lithium battery is lighter.
customer_reviews.author: AKP29

customer_reviews.title: Light enough to use by a 74 year old
customer_reviews.text: Love it And the battery from our blower and this weed eater are interchangeable. Love it. So light I can hold it without any trouble and move it around very easiy
customer_reviews.author: Linda  Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight tool but effective.
customer_reviews.text: Knowing this trimmer was a lightweight tool I am amazed at how good it works. Now I use it to trim around my gatden beds and other small jobs. My yard does not require a lot of edging. The one downside I find is the string not feeding like it should. I am having to take the spool off and feed string out.
customer_reviews.author: jima a

customer_reviews.title: Woefully under powered for all but the smallest jobs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the B&D 24v trimmer which I have owned since 2008. It worked like a champ so I replaced it with the closest model available today. Out of the box the assembly was minimal, the 20v battery took a while to reach full charge. Overall first impression was that the unit was "less robust" than the unit it was replacing. After five minutes of use I knew I was returning the unit. The unit didn't have enough power to edge my lawn and the edge guide was not at all helpful. The show stopper was the units failure to feed trimmer line. Guess I'm gonna have to spring for a Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: CGC

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and easy to use. More powerful that thought.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is easy to use and easy to charge the batteries. The line extends on it's own, so you never need to bump and feed the trimmer line. I thought the battery wouldn't have enough power to cut the weeds but I was wrong. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jack W.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This works well. Isn’t meant for heavy duty anything or if your grass gets too tall. It’s adjustable and lightweight so the kids can use it too. To keep it turn on you have to keep your finger on a button at all times (slightly inconvenient). Battery takes quite a few hours to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: LOPEZ

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer, very light weight and the auto feed works perfectly on mine. The battery outlasted the area I need it for, so no complaints on that, either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery is worthless; trimmer works well but it can't
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer itself is fine but I got about five trips around the yard with this before the battery stopped taking charges. I ordered a spare battery at the time and it also will no longer take a charge. I'm going back to electric or perhaps gas and this is going to the dump.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Puckett

customer_reviews.title: Really decent battery powered weed eater for the price. ...
customer_reviews.text: Really decent battery powered weed eater for the price. I had the cheaper corded version so I was already familiar with stringing the line. However, it has been much easier to just buy the pre-wound rolls for this guy. They take a long time to get through as long as you aren't abusing the line.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he is very happy with it. Easy to use and charge lasts long enough to do the whole yard and its still charged. We have a big yard too.
customer_reviews.author: ptowngirl

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer, bad battery
customer_reviews.text: It's a good trimmer, works as advertised; light weight, convenient and doesn't give a nytrouble. However, the battery is disappointing. I have now fully charged and discharged it 6-7 times, the battery lasts exactly 20 minutes. Since i have a small yard and tend to work short durations, this is alright but if you expect 1 hour as claimed you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product at a low price. Good for a smallish to medium property. Just don’t expect the same “oomph” of an electric or gas powered weed whacker!
customer_reviews.author: J. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Works great but need extra battery.
customer_reviews.text: Great little light duty trimmer. Be sure to get an extra battery. The one battery won't last that long if you're trimming around the average yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: Great little trimmer. Long grass will wrap around drum and stop the trimmer. Start from the top and work your way down the long grass and it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these two years ago and it’s still rocking along and working great. I’m an older, small woman and an avid gardener but a full size weedeater is too much for me. This one works perfectly and can handle pretty tall grass in a pinch (with much shorter battery life). The batteries do run out quickly (20-30 minutes) so I’ve bought 4 and two chargers. That way, I can get 2 hours of work in easily.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: The actual trimmer itself is what you would expect for ...
customer_reviews.text: The actual trimmer itself is what you would expect for the price. But after 2 charges the battery charger itself isn't functioning. Do to this not sure if want to risk buying another item within the same lineup to get another charger or just write the purchase off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What??? No Battery (twice)
customer_reviews.text: Received unit in a box that had been packed inside another box. The box that contained the product from Black and Decker had been retaped, Batterie Not Included. Rendered it useless. But it is light weight and can be handled easily if I could use it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX String Trimmer/Edger Kit, 10-Inch (LST201)
product_meta.description: Style:20V String Trimmer KItThe BLACK+DECKER LST201 20V MAX Lithium 10 Inch String Trimmer/Edger is a Part of the 20V MAX System - 1 System. Endless Tasks. Power for your Style. This unit is designed for areas of overgrowth after mowing, and also for edging of grass around borders, walkways and posts. It easily converts from trimmer to wheeled edger. The Automatic Feed Spool (AFS) automatically feeds trimmer line when needed with no bumping required. It features a lightweight design of only 4.5 lbs., with an adjustable height and handle for ideal user comfort. A 20V MAX Lithium Ion 1.5Ah battery holds it's charge for up to 18 months. Cut Swath - 10 in, Line Size - 0.065 in, RPM - 9,000, Replacement Spool - AF-100. Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 20 votes. Nominal voltage is 18. Includes: (1) LST201 20V MAX Cordless Trimmer/Edger, (1) LBXR20 20V MAX Lithium Ion Battery, (1) Charger, (1) AFS Spool, (1) Guard
feature_bullets: Part of the 20V MAX System; 1 System - Endless Tasks. Power for your Style
Converts from trimmer to wheeled edger
Automatic Feed Spool (AFS) automatically feeds trimmer line
Adjustable height and handle for ideal user comfort
20V MAX Lithium Ion 1.5Ah battery holds it's charge for up to 18 months
Included Components: (1) LST200 20V MAX* 10" Trimmer, (1) LBXR20 20V MAX* Lithium Battery, (1) Charger, (1) Guard, (1) AFS Spool; Power Source: Lithium Ion

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,439 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
